meanings.definition: For an unlimited or unspecified period of time.
meanings.sent1: She waited indefinitely for the bus to arrive.
meanings.sent2: The store will be closed indefinitely due to unforeseen circumstances.
meanings.sent3: The cat stared indefinitely at the moving toy, unsure whether to pounce or not.
meanings.sent4: His love for her was like a river flowing indefinitely, never ceasing.
meanings.sent5: The stars in the night sky seemed to twinkle indefinitely, creating a mesmerizing sight.

meanings.sent1: The project had an indefinitely long timeline for completion.
meanings.sent2: His patience was tested by the indefinitely long line at the grocery store.
meanings.sent3: The magician's hat seemed to hold an indefinitely large number of rabbits.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like an indefinitely expanding horizon, always bright and welcoming.
meanings.sent5: The forest appeared to stretch out indefinitely, with no end in sight.

meanings.sent1: The movie had an indefinitely suspenseful ending, leaving the audience in awe.
meanings.sent2: The road seemed to continue indefinitely, disappearing into the distance.
meanings.sent3: The cake was decorated with an indefinitely swirling pattern of frosting.
meanings.sent4: His laughter echoed indefinitely in the empty room, a sound of pure joy.
meanings.sent5: The mystery of the old house lingered indefinitely in the minds of the curious townspeople.
